name: Dr. Mohammad Imran
title: Associate Professor of Hadith
about: Dr. Mohammad Imran has over two decades of experience teaching Hadith, Tafsir and classical Arabic. He supervises postgraduate research, publishes on hadith methodology, and runs community mentorship programmes focused on applied scholarship and student development.
bio: 20+ years teaching Hadith, Tafsir, and classical Arabic. Passionate about student mentorship and research. Supervises MA theses and regularly gives public seminars on hadith authentication.

philosophy.title: Islamic Studies Teaching Philosophy
philosophy.content:
I believe education in Islamic Studies should focus on:
• Accessibility First: making knowledge available to all
• Practical Application: real-world implementation of skills
• Continuous Innovation: keeping up with latest research and methods
• Student-Centric Design: prioritizing student engagement and success

reviews.name: Ali H.
reviews.comment: Excellent instructor, very clear and engaging!

name: Ustadhah Ayesha Rahman
title: Senior Lecturer — Arabic Language
about: Ustadhah Ayesha specializes in Arabic morphology (sarf) and syntax (nahw) with extensive experience designing adult reading and fluency programmes. Her classes emphasize reading practice, communicative drills and carefully scaffolded grammar exercises.
bio: Specialist in Arabic morphology and pedagogy. Loves designing interactive reading courses for adults. Has developed modular curriculum for intermediate-to-advanced learners and leads teacher-training workshops.

name: Prof. Khalid Hasan
title: Professor — Fiqh & Usul
about: Professor Khalid is a noted researcher in comparative fiqh and usul al-fiqh. He directs community legal education initiatives and publishes comparative jurisprudence research that bridges classical doctrine with contemporary issues.
bio: Researcher of comparative fiqh with deep interest in community-led legal education. Supervises research projects that examine modern applications of classical rulings and comparative methodologies.

name: Dr. Noor Fatima
title: Lecturer — Islamic History
about: Dr. Noor Fatima researches early Islamic civilization and highlights female scholarship across Islamic history. She authors books and organizes research seminars aimed at bringing historical narratives into contemporary study.
bio: Author and educator focusing on early Islamic civilization and female scholarship. Teaches source criticism, historiography and research methods tailored for undergraduate and postgraduate students.

name: Sheikh Abdullah Al-Rashid
title: Senior Instructor — Qur'an Memorization
about: Sheikh Abdullah specializes in tajweed and memorization pedagogy. He has trained many huffaz using incremental memorization techniques and focuses on preserving correct recitation and melodic rhythm.
bio: Specializing in Quranic memorization techniques and classical Arabic with 15 years experience. Runs memorization cohorts and tajweed clinics for learners of all ages.

name: Dr. Hana Al-Mansouri
title: Lecturer — Islamic Law
about: Dr. Hana researches contemporary fiqh and legal applications, focusing on adapting classical rulings to modern contexts. She teaches case-based courses that prepare students to apply jurisprudence principles practically.
bio: Expert in contemporary Islamic law applications and modern fiqh challenges. Teaches applied fiqh, regulatory frameworks and conducts workshops for legal practitioners.
